metadata.title: CVE-2017-7700 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In Wireshark 2.2.0 to 2.2.5 and 2.0.0 to 2.0.11, the NetScaler file parsercould go into an infinite loop, triggered by a malformed capture file. Thiswas addressed in wiretap/netscaler.c by ensuring a nonzero record size.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7700` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
libwireshark11 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
libwiretap8 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
libwsutil9 - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
tshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
wireshark - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
wireshark-common - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
wireshark-qt - 2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.3-1~ubuntu16.04.1').
